Dear BRANDON HANNAH:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 248-860-0787.
Sincerely,

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Interventions Standards and Prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
1

(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff used improper physical management technique causing
scratches of youth's neck.
Investigation I reviewed intake dated 07/03/2023. It states on 07/01/2023 that
Youth A assaulted Staff Person 1 and that Staff Person 1 did not
use the proper restraint technique causing scratches to Youth A’s
neck.
I reviewed incident report dated 07/01/2023 completed by Staff
Person 1. It states Staff Person 1 sitting in the second-floor
hallway when Supervisor walked inside the lounge and started to
aggravate Youth A. Youth A kept asking Supervisor to stop and
that she continued to aggravate him. Staff Person 2 then told
Staff Person 1 that Supervisor was punching Youth A in the face
and that Staff Person 1 entered the lounge, got in between them,
and stopped the altercation. Staff Person 2’s attached written
statement to the incident report notes Supervisor entering the
lounge to say goodbye to Youth A, which he did not reply and
appeared upset. Supervisor said, “I told you I was going to mess
with you”, which Youth A stated “Get out of my face. Leave me
alone.” Supervisor continued to antagonize Youth A while smiling
and knowing Youth A was already agitated. Youth A then threw a
box of DVD’s and poured some conditioner on Supervisor.
Supervisor took the conditioner and poured it on Youth A.
Supervisor and Youth A began tussling and ended up on the floor
where Staff Person 2 witnessed Supervisor punch Youth A in the
head a few times while stating, “I’m not these other staff. I will
(expletive) you up”. Staff Person 1 entered and intervened at
which point Supervisor eventually left the lounge. Youth was
taken to get cleaned up and supervisors were notified.
I reviewed video surveillance of the tv lounge on the second floor
of the facility dated 07/01/2023 at noon. It shows Staff Person 2
and Youths A and B sitting as Supervisor enters. Supervisor is
observed standing in a corner when Youth A takes a box and
overturns the contents and then place the box over his head.
Youth A then squeezes a bottle of shampoo at Supervisor to
which she grabs the bottle and squeezes the shampoo on Youth
A. Youth A walks to the far wall and Supervisor follows him.
When Supervisor approaches Youth A he takes a swing at her
and then Supervisor takes a swing at Youth A and then pushes
2

him to the floor. Youth A grabs at Supervisor’s hair and
Supervisor continues to hold Youth A down and takes
approximately four swings at Youth A hitting him in the upper
body. Staff Person 1 enters the tv room and gets in between
Supervisor and Youth A and briefly holds onto Youth A’s arms.
Supervisor walks away, returns to pull away a cord Youth A is
holding, and then leaves the tv room.
I interviewed Youth A onsite with DHHS Worker on 07/03/2023.
He reports being in the upstairs tv room with Youth B and Staff
Person’s 1 and 2. He states Supervisor entered the room and
said that she was going to mess with him before she left. Youth A
states he thought Supervisor was playing at first and then noticed
that she was upset. Supervisor got in his face/personal space
which required him to back up four to five times. Youth A states
he put his arms up at which point Supervisor hit him a couple
times and that she then grabbed his neck and threw him to the
floor. Youth A states Staff Person’s 1 and 2 pulled Supervisor off
him and that she left the tv room. Youth A states this is the first
time such an incident has occurred with Supervisor.
I interviewed Youth B onsite with DHHS Worker on 07/03/2023.
He reports being in the tv room with Youth A when Supervisor
entered and irritated Youth A. He states Youth A punched
Supervisor at which point he exited the room. Youth B states that
he recalls Supervisor having Youth A on the floor and later saw
scratches on Youth A’s face.
I interviewed Supervisor, via telephone, with DHHS Worker on
07/05/2023. She reports being employed by the facility since
12/2022 and is updated in her Crisis Prevention Intervention
training. She reports having worked overtime and that she was
about to leave the facility. She reports Youth A having previously
been AWOL from the facility and that she followed him a portion of
the time and that he came back having consumed alcohol and
noting that he was cranky. She reports assigning Youth A a
different one-on-one and that she approached Youth A for a hug
before leaving. She states Youth A poured shampoo on her and
that she then poured shampoo on Youth A. Supervisor then
reports Youth A hit her a couple of times and that she then hit
Youth A as well “Maybe two times”. Supervisor then reports
putting Youth A to the floor and pinned him down stating that she
was trying to protect herself and that the other staff did not assist
noting that what she was doing was not per policy. Supervisor
states she has not had any other incidents like the one she had
with Youth A.
3

I interviewed Staff Person 1 onsite with DHHS Worker on
07/05/2023. He reports being Youth A’s one-on-one and
positioned in the hallway just outside of the tv room and that Staff
Person 2 was inside the room with Youth A and B. He reports that
Supervisor entered the tv room calm and stated, “I’m going to
mess with Youth A one more time before I leave”. Staff Person 1
states hearing Youth A state, “Leave me alone”. Staff Person 1
then states that Staff Person 2 entered the hallway and exclaimed,
“She’s beating him up”. Staff Person 2 reports he got in between
Supervisor and Youth A and that Youth A grabbed hold of
Supervisor’s charging cord and wig before she left the tv room.
I unsuccessfully attempted to contact Staff Person 2, via
telephone, with DHHS Worker on 07/05/2023. Staff Person 2
returned DHHS Worker’s call on 07/20/2023 which this writer was
not part of. DHHS Worker’s interview with Staff Person2 is as
follows:
Staff Person 2 states she was working with the group in the
tv room. Supervisor came on the unit noting that she
thought that Supervisor had already was gone for the day.
She reports Supervisor informed Staff Person 2 that she
was going to say goodbye to Youth A since she was his
one-on-one for the day and told him, “I told you I was going
to mess with you prior to leaving for the day”. She reports
Youth A got upset with Supervisor and informed her not to
talk to him and to “Leave me the (expletive) alone”. Staff
Person 2 reports Youth A picked up a box full of DVD’s,
threw them at Supervisor, and then put the box on his head.
Staff Person 2 reports Supervisor continued to talk with
Youth A at which point Youth A squirted his bottle of hair
cream at Supervisor. Staff Person 2 states Supervisor took
the hair cream away from Youth A and squirted it on him as
well. Youth A walked away and that Supervisor went
behind him. Staff Person 2 states the next things she knew
was that Youth A was on the floor and Supervisor was
standing and tussling with him. Staff Person 2 called for
assistance and that a male staff person came in and
intervened. Staff Person 2 states Supervisor hit Youth A in
the head and on his body. and informing her supervisor of
the incident. Staff Person 2 states this was the first and
only time she saw an incident like this at the center, stating
that it was “weird”, as it was a supervisor doing it. Staff
Person 2 then reports informing her supervisor of the
incident.
4

DHHS Worker reports findings with her investigation summary.
Analysis Video review, as well as consistent staff and youth interviews,
show that Supervisor verbally instigated Youth A followed by her
pouring a hair product on Youth A, as well as hitting, grabbing,
and forcibly placing Youth A on the floor before hitting him again.
Supervisor admits to pouring shampoo on Youth A after he had
poured some on her, as well as admitting to hitting Youth A
“Maybe two times” after Youth A hit her a couple times and admits
to pinning Youth A to the floor. Supervisor states what she was
doing was not per policy.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (2) A person who has unsupervised contact with children shall not
Description have been convicted of either of the following:
(a) Child abuse or neglect.
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
(b) Experience to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Supervisor verbally instigated, poured a hair product on, hit,
grabbed, and forcibly placed Youth A on the floor.
Investigation As noted in the above investigation summary and findings,
Supervisor did in fact do these things. As a result, the DHHS
Worker established findings.
Analysis Supervisor demonstrated an inability to perform duties as
assigned.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
